fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26480].
  {panel}

I'm using an EventListener to try to automatically transition issues in particular states, of particular types and for particular deployment environments (a custom attribute of the issue) to subsequent states.

The logic is failing, though, because the workflow entry associated with the issue is still in the CREATED state, not the ACTIVATED state.

I need a way to be notified when the workflow entry associated with an issue has been activated, because the time of the issue's creation is apparently too early.

I'm willing to implement a workaround, maybe even one that can be incorporated in some form into the JIRA codebase in the future, but I have to find a way to do this.

Is there a way for me to register a wrapper delegate for the WorkflowStore interface that gets used instead so that I can enable the registration of listeners to this store and so that I can make sure that these listeners are called when either createEntry() or setEntryState() is invoked?

I saw that OSWorkflow has WorkflowListener and WorkflowLocalListener, but these require you to implement EJBs.

And I tried a work-around that was documented below, but temporarily turning on indexing made no difference:

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257303594

Here is my related question on Atlassian Answers:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/24245/why-is-jira-saying-that-a-perfectly-valid-transition-for-my-issue-is-invalid
fields.summary: Cannot transition an issue upon its creation, because its workflow entry is still not active

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26469].
  {panel}

The CHANGED operator is JQL is very useful, but adding a NOT CHANGED operator would be very beneficial as well.

For example: 'status = "In Progress" AND status NOT CHANGED AFTER "-7d"' to find issues which are effectively stalled.

This is useful for teams implementing continous flow processes like KANBAN. Combined with the Greenhopper rapid board and quick filters a NOT CHANGED operator could help quickly hightlight things stalled on the board.

This behaviour can be simulated with current JQL by combining status WAS and status CHANGED, but this has to be specified for each status to observe, which is very hard to maintain when you have a more complex workflow.
fields.summary: Add NOT CHANGED operator to JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26460].
  {panel}

Hi 

I pretty well understand why a [Plugins Policy|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Atlassian+OnDemand+Plugin+Policy] was introduced in the JIRA OnDemand. Stability and security are the problems that prevent you from allowing to install JIRA plugins into OnDemand.

However, I also pretty well understand that it's possible to isolate environments in which different OnDemand instances run to make sure one client will not ruin the other client's systems. Virtualisation fully solves that. So it's possible to solve inter-environment stability and security issues.

Stability & security issues at user's own instance are just a matter of sending a clear message to OnDemand customers, saying - "we carry no responsibility for thirdparty plugins problems". As long as you allow to install plugins onto the downloaded solution - you are allowing users to ruin themselves in their own selfhosted instances. I don't see then why not allow same thing for Atlassian hosted environment, as long as this will not affect other customers. It will bring major benefit of plugins exchange to OnDemand users. 

Thanks
Alex

PS: I've found no paticular project for OnDemand system, so posting to main JIRA project. Please lead me to OnDemand dedicated space, as I have more to post for it.
fields.summary: allow plugins for JIRA OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26453].
  {panel}

When a user currently logs back in after a session timeout by clicking on a link to an attachment, the login screen comes up and allows the user to log in and the attachment is downable, but the url is not redirected to the dashboard, it stays at the login screen. Can we change this so that the user is directed to their dashboard as they normally would when they login?

To reproduce:

1. Login to Jira
2. Open an existing ticket which has as an attachment(In my case I had an excel file attached to the ticket)
3. Keep the page open until the session gets timed out
4. After the session has been timed out, click on the attachment present to the ticket
5. User would be redirected to Login Page
6. Enter credentials and click on Login Button
7. User would still be on Login page only. How ever the attachment has been downloaded.
8. Hit the Login button again and notice that the attachment would be downloaded again. But user would still be on Login Page.
9. Try to refresh the page. Attachment would be downloaded again. But user would be still on Login Page

The url displayed is:

http://jiraserver:8080/login.jsp?permissionViolation=true&os_destination=%2Fsecure%2Fattachment%2F18351%2FWorkbook1.xlsx
fields.summary: Redirect to dashboard after logging in after session timeout when trying to download an attachment

  {panel}

When issues are split accross components, they get counted multiple times in the pie chart, for each component (understandably) but the summary is misleading, it totals the number of issues accross components, counting the same issue mulitple times for all components it refers to.  The confusion is that when you drill in, the total issues are not what is reported in the chart.

It might be more appropriate for ByComponent views to describe:
- Total issues (current behaviour)
- Total unique issue count (reflecting unduplicated count)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26445].
  {panel}

We have the Greenhopper/Agile plugin on our Jira. On the Issue Navigator, through Tools > Configure Columns I added the "Story Points" column. It appears in the "Re-order columns" view and I can see populated values.

When I click back to "Issue Navigator", the column is missing. But, if I filter on *all* issue types (i.e. ensure every issue type in the list is selected) - the story points column magically appears. If I search with just "Any" issue type selected however, the Story Points column vanishes again. As far as I can tell, the column is visible whenever I choose any issue type other than "Any" - so just choosing 'standard issue types' also makes the column visible.

In JQL:
works - I can see "Story Points" column with any of these examples:
{code}
issuetype in standardIssueTypes()
issuetype in ("New Feature", epic)
{code}

A blank JQL query however (equivalent to "Any" issue type) does not work - I cannot see "Story Points" column.

It also seems to hide the column if my filter does not select any issue types (such as epic or story) that have stories. So for example, if I filter on "New Feature" or "Bug", it does not show the story points column. That seems reasonable. It _does_ show the column if my filter includes both "New Feature" and Epic (see second JQL above), i.e. one issue type that has story points and one that does not - which is also good. However if I choose "Any" issue type, that should include any Epics and Stories and show the associated story points. (it should certainly give the same results as when I individually select all of the possible issue types).

Additionally, this also affects the 'Export'>>'Excel (All fields)'.  The 'Story Points' field will not be exported if it is not displayed in the issue navigator.  If you adjust the JQL to {code}"Story Points" is not EMPTY{code} the export functionality will function as expected.
fields.summary: Visibility of column in issue navigator is different depending on whether I choose "Any" issue type, or select all the issue types.
We need the opportunity to search with leading wildcards.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26419].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

The markdown renderer that Jira Cloud uses only recognizes HTTP-based URL's and URI's. Trying to embed links using other protocols, such as _smb_, _file_, or _doors_, Jira's markdown renderer fails to recognize them as legit hyperlinks.
h3. Suggested Solution

Support links to other resources that use non http/https protocols
h3. Why this is important

This is particular important for teams that have existing internal network storage, and don't want to duplicate where those files are stored by copying them to Jira's attachments. In many cases it would be very helpful for end users that can see a Jira issue, or a JSD request to be able to see links to internal resources in some scenarios.
h3. Workaround

There are no work-around for this in Jira Cloud at this time. Should one become available this section will be updated to reflect this.
fields.summary: Non-HTTP links are not recognized as Links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26413].
  {panel}

When AD is selected the "Enable Incremental Synchronisation" option appears in "Advanced Settings". We don't document this option.

We need to document this option. We also need to mention that this option only works when the user configured for the synchronisation has:

# Read access to the {{uSNChanged}} attribute on all the users and groups in the directory that need to be synchronised.
# Read access to the objects and attributes in the Deleted Objects container (http://support.microsoft.com/kb/892806).

If either of these is not true you may end up with added (deleted) AD users not being added (deleted) in JIRA. See http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/YAfuDw.

REF: CWD-2713, CWD-2714
fields.summary: The LDAP configuration documentation does not document "Enable Incremental Synchronisation:" AD option.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26411].
  {panel}

We have a periodic problem in user search where a user cannot be found due to a limited 20-hit match list, commmon names, spelling variations and a large user base (e.g. us, 15000 potential users in ldap database.)

Example: Attempting to add David Smith as watcher. (This is a real example.)
1. Type *david* - too many matches
2. Type *smith* - too many matches
3. Type *dsmith* - no hit, his username is dpsmith3
4. Type *david.smith*, attempting an email match - no hit, this sometimes works for us but here his  mail address has been disambiguated to david.p.smith@xxx.  

This can also happen where there are variations of names, eg, deb/debra, or alternate spellings.  Using a broader target gives too may hits to pick the user but a narrow search misses altogether.

Suggested fixes:
1. Use a *dot* for an AND search, so _david.smith_ requires a match on _david_ and _smith_ (y)  
2. Allow scrolling/paging of the full hit list.
3. All the above.

Option 1 is the snappiest from a usability point of view but paging is probably easier to understand.  A hint "Displaying 20 of 237 matching users. (+Search Tips+)" on an overflowing picklist would be great.

  {panel}

Please mention checking  *Allow users to vote on issues = on* inside of JIRA General Configuration when setting up voting inside of JIRA.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Watching+and+Voting+on+an+Issue

The following has helped previously in guiding when voting was not available:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. In the administration, go to "General Configuration".
3. Set the "Allow users to vote on issues" to "on".
4. Please retry that voting process.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26375].
  {panel}

Incorrect Exception message thrown, which misleads users.

Also see
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-3325

The Exception thrown when entering a permission related workflow step variable looks like following:
{code}
java.lang.RuntimeException: Error parsing meta attribute <meta name='jira.permission.edit'>false</meta>. Name format is 'jira.permission.[subtasks].<permission>.[group|user|assignee|...]'
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] java.lang.RuntimeException: Error parsing meta attribute <meta name='jira.permission.edit'>false</meta>. Name format is 'jira.permission.[subtasks].<permission>.[group|user|assignee|...]'
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.WorkflowPermissionFactory.createWorkflowPermission(WorkflowPermissionFactory.java:81)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.WorkflowPermissionFactory.getWorkflowPermissions(WorkflowPermissionFactory.java:41)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.hasPermission(WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.java:75)
{code}

The user mistook the format (jira.permission.[subtasks].<permission>.[group|user|assignee|...]) for a pseudo regex, and thought subtask as well as the last part were optional, where only the subtask in fact is. According to the documentation

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Workflow+Properties

which links to

http://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/latest/com/atlassian/jira/security/WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.html

the correct format is 'jira.permission.[subtasks.]\{permission}.\{type}\[.suffix]'

Please adapt the Exception message accordingly.

*Scenario 2:*
We have tested to add the workflow property and reproducible in JIRA 4.4.5, 5.0.7, 5.1.8 and 5.2.11:
* jira.permission.work = denied

It looks like the property is doing it's job, and the log work feature will be disable for that specific issue status.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Go to {{Administration > Workflows}}
# Edit the related workflow, and create a draft workflow if required
# Go to any of the workflow step (not transition!), open the property for that workflow step
# Add the following property:
{noformat}
jira.permission.work = denied
{noformat}

*Finding:*
Though the property seems to work, it looks like apparently we managed to reproduce the problem as well. In our test setup, the log work is disabled in the In Progress step due to the property, but when we try to resolve the issue, we get the following error:
{noformat}
2013-05-23 22:24:21,341 http-bio-8081-exec-11 ERROR admin 1344x11961x1 1lif4su 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/IssueAction!default.jspa [atlassian.jira.permission.WorkflowPermissionFactory] Error parsing meta attribute <meta name='jira.permission.work'>denied</meta>. Name format is 'jira.permission.[subtasks].<permission>.[group|user|assignee|...]'
2013-05-23 22:24:21,342 http-bio-8081-exec-11 ERROR admin 1344x11961x1 1lif4su 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/IssueAction!default.jspa [atlassian.plugin.web.DefaultWebInterfaceManager] Could not evaluate condition 'com.atlassian.plugin.web.conditions.AndCompositeCondition@63e5635f' for descriptor: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issueoperations:log-work (null)
java.lang.RuntimeException: Error parsing meta attribute <meta name='jira.permission.work'>denied</meta>. Name format is 'jira.permission.[subtasks].<permission>.[group|user|assignee|...]'
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.WorkflowPermissionFactory.createWorkflowPermission(WorkflowPermissionFactory.java:81)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.WorkflowPermissionFactory.getWorkflowPermissions(WorkflowPermissionFactory.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.hasPermission(WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.AbstractPermissionManager.hasPermission(AbstractPermissionManager.java:113)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.AbstractPermissionManager.hasPermission(AbstractPermissionManager.java:142)  <+2> (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
{noformat}

Hello,

it would be great, if there was a possibility to send an email-notification to *certain comments*.
I want to choose, which comments should be sent to the users specified in the notification scheme, not every comment or change on the ticket should cause an email.
In my imagination, there is a button on the right side of each comment, which is used for sending out an email to a specified recipient.

Is there already a feature like this?

	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.SelectCFType.compare(SelectCFType.java:40)

fields.description:
Dear,

We did an export-import of Jira data from version 3.13 to Version 4.3. 
Everything works fine exeptionally when we click on 'Work log' of an issue to see the history of the entered worked hours, we receive the error message "An unknown error occurred - actions == null. Please see logs for more details." 
This only appears when there are hours nog logged by the current user. fe. User x logged hours on Issue 1 in Jira 3.13, when user x clicks on Work log, he can see the history, when user y clicks on worklog of Issue1, he receives the error message.

The same message appears when we click on 'All' but not on the other tabs like comments or Change History.

This is an importand issue for us because we planned the upgrade next saterday the 26th of November.

Regards,
Evelyne
fields.summary: work log error - "An unknown error occurred - actions == null. Please see logs for more details."

Hello,

I would like to request a stalker bar. The blue bar in JIRA containing "Dashboard, Projects, issues, agile, create issue and search field" is not visible if there are to much comments on a page and the user scrolls down the page.

A stalker bar will remain visible where ever the user is on a page and therefore it's access ability is better.

I hope you can use this request.

Kind regards,

Xander

Its just too long.  It doesnt help diagnose problems to be this long.  In fact its a barrier to diagnosing problems.

log4j can filter the stack trace output and JIRA should put some smarts into this.
fields.summary: JIRA should cut down the size of the stack traces it generates.
Restructure Add User Dirctory page so Advanced Connection Test has to be performed
Add a "re-index needed" flag, that plugins can set when installed/upgraded/configured

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26304].
  {panel}

Adding 'anyone' to jira-system-administrators privileges breaks admin panel.

So, aside from the obviously bad nature of adding the anyone group to this permission, it tends to leave things in a broken state afterwards. The Admin panel does not render anything and there are stack traces in the logs like this:

{noformat}
Nov 11, 2011 4:05:07 PM org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationDispatcher
invoke
SEVERE: Servlet.service() for servlet jsp threw exception
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: entityNameToMatch argument cannot be
null
at org.apache.commons.lang.Validate.notNull(Validate.java:192)
at
com.atlassian.crowd.search.query.membership.MembershipQuery.<init>(MembershipQuery.java:26)
at
com.atlassian.crowd.search.query.membership.UserMembersOfGroupQuery.<init>(UserMembersOfGroupQuery.java:11)
at
com.atlassian.crowd.search.builder.QueryBuilder.createMembershipQuery(QueryBuilder.java:179)
at
com.atlassian.crowd.search.builder.QueryBuilder$PartialMembershipQueryWithNameToMatch.returningAtMost(QueryBuilder.java:287)
at
com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.getGroupMembers(UserUtilImpl.java:1197)
...
{noformat}

What's curious about this, is I can't replicate it on a clean install, but the problem has occurred to a number of customers - they did appear to be using apache or other proxies to clean up the URL in each case.

We've got a number of tickets about warning people when adding the anyone group here - I wonder if there's possibly now enough reason to prevent people from adding the anyone group to jira-system-admins at all? Is there even a use case for that permission?

h3. Workaround

Please refer to our [Error Creating New Ticket or Accessing Administration Section After JIRA Upgrade|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Error+Creating+New+Ticket+or+Accessing+Administration+Section+After+JIRA+Upgrade] KB article for further information on how to fix this.

h3. Suggested Fix

Add an upgrade task to check for this, and if it exists remove those 'Anyone' permissions provided it does not restrict access to log into the instance.

h3. Notes

It is also possible this error may occur when performing an in-place upgrade from 3.3.1 to 4.4.5. This is not the recommended method, please use the XML method as per [Upgrading JIRA 3.x Data to JIRA 6.x|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+3.x+Data+to+JIRA+6.x].
fields.summary: Prevent 'Anyone' role from being assigned sysadmin permissions
Provide a way to revert truncation in workflow (and all other) drop downs
Bulk Move within the same project doesn't allow update of required Component and Affects Version
Make the Answer's gadget of support.atlassian.com publicly available

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26298].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Configure two JIRA application to use the same connector port at {{server.xml}}
# Startup the first JIRA
# Use the upgrade tool (atlassian-jira-4.4-x32.bin) to upgrade the second JIRA
{quote}
Your existing JIRA installation is about to be upgraded! Do you want to proceed?
Yes [y, Enter], No [n]

Your instance of JIRA is currently being upgraded.
Checking if JIRA has been shutdown...
JIRA failed to shutdown. Please kill the process manually before proceeding.
Continue [c, Enter], Exit [e]
{quote}

It seems that the upgrade tool use the port number in {{server.xml}} to detect whether the application is running.
However, the message of the failure is not clear if the port is used by other application.

Should have a warning message asking if there is any application using the same port.
fields.summary: A better warning message if the upgrade tool fail because of the port used by other application

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26297].
  {panel}

Please polish the content I am providing below and include it in JIRA 4.4.4 release notes (or perhaps rather summarise it with a sentence or two and link to a separate page with more details).

As described in JRA-26239, we decided to break backward compatibility in JIRA 4.4.4 release with respect to a piece of the API related to mail handling (which, as far as we know, is not used often).

h2. Incompatibilities

JIRA 4.4.4 includes a dependency on {{atlassian-mail}} version {{1.25}} which is not 100% backward compatible with {{atlassian-mail 1.24}} included in previous releases of JIRA.

JRIA 4.4.4 also ships with {{javamail 1.4.4}}, which we cannot guarantee is 100% compatible with {{javamail 1.4.1}} (shipped with previous releases of JIRA).

Hence, there are two significant points to note as a result of these changes:
* The {{com.atlassian.mail.server.MailServer.getSession()}} method returns objects of the {{javax.mail.Session}} class rather than {{alt.javax.mail.Session}}
* The classes from {{mockobjects-j1.3-j2ee1.3.jar}} are no longer exported (i.e. made available) to Atlassian version 2 plugins. This {{jar}} is no longer distributed with JIRA.

h2. Potential Impact and Solution

* We believe that very few (if any) 3rd party plugins will be affected by the two changes mentioned above and that such plugins will be broken as a result of these changes.
\\
** If your plugin uses the {{com.atlassian.mail.server.MailServer.getSession()}} method, doing either of the following should be sufficient to get it working with JIRA 4.4.4:
*** Recompile your plugin against 4.4.4
*** Use a higher level class like {{MailQueueItem}}.
\\ \\
** If your plugin depends on {{mockobjects-j1.3-j2ee1.3.jar}} (which is highly unlikely and could be considered questionable), we encourage you to either:
*** Remove this dependency or
*** If it is not possible to remove this dependency, bundle this {{jar}} with the plugin.

According to the changelog for {{javamail}} (http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javaee/changes-220864.txt), we believe that these changes should not negatively impact current plugins. On the contrary, many bug fixes and compatibility improvements in this new version of {{javamail}} should make existing JIRA mail handlers more robust.

h2. Rationale

JIRA 4.4.4 comes with substantial mail logging improvements and capabilities, which should be valuable to customers and support personnel troubleshooting problems related to incoming and outgoing mail.

Part of this feature work required the need to upgrade both the {{atlassian-mail}} and {{javamail}} libraries to the versions mentioned above. The anticipated small negative impact resulting from these upgraded libraries led us to believe that there was little or no business justification for supporting their older versions.
fields.summary: Document mail-related API incompatibilities in incoming JIRA 4.4.4

Suggestion for an improvement:

++++ Problem: ++++
the release notes of a project do not reflect the hierarchy of the issues(tasks...) and sub-tasks.
Only a simple list of issues (grouped by type) is displayed.
This list is not suitable for a release documentation. It is only a flat log list and it is not better than a filtered view.
e.g.

EPICS:
======

EPIC 01
EPIC 02
EPIC 03
STORIES:
========

STORY 01
STORY 02
TECHNICAL TASKS:
================

PART 01
PART 02
SCENE 01
SCENE 02
++++ ToDo ++++
display the issues and sub-tasks as a hierarchically structured list.
e.g.

EPICS:
======

EPIC 01
PART 01 (Technical Tasks)
PART 02 (Technical Tasks)
EPIC 02
EPIC 03
STORIES:
========

STORY 01
SCENE 01 (Technical Tasks)
SCENE 02 (Technical Tasks)
STORY 02

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26276].
  {panel}

As discussed in [JSP-95513|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-95513] it is currently not possible to set the property option {{ops.bar.group.size.opsbar-transitions}} to 0

I expected the following behavior:
* (-) set value to 0: Only the "Workflow" Dropdown is visible, all Transitions are included there
* (/) set a value x betweed 1 and n-1 (where n is the number of maximum transitions available atm): get x Buttons plus the workflow dropdown with additional transitions (works as expected)
* (!) set a value x that is higher than the maximum of transitions available: get all transtitions as buttons (nevertheless it is good to the users UI) but hide the Workflow Dropdown (currently only the workflow field is disabled but not hidden)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26272].
  {panel}

As documented in https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-96310 it's not possible anymore to easily modify the default filters shown
on the profile page. As a result, if a company want the users to quickly show issues in a custom status, there's no way to reach that.
See screenshot.

For example, the "Assigned & In Progress" filter is hard-coded to jira-url/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=status+%3D+%223%22+AND+assignee+%3D+currentUser%28%29
which translates to this jql: status = "3" AND assignee = currentUser()  

If the open status is not 3, or if we have different stati that represent "Open", we cannot change that.

It would be nice to be able to customize those queries, either by editing the jsp or having a property for each

Thanks
Olivier
fields.summary: Provide a way to customize the default filters shown on the profile page

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26251].
  {panel}

Hello,

searchrequest-xml allows to limit returned fields by listing them in URI
field=updated&field=components

Great feature. But not very convenient for use if we need to take all fields excluding Comments and Description.

We don't need those fields cause they eat too much traffic, but excluding them create enourmous GET request.

Would be nice to have opposite feature
excludefield=comment&excludefield=description - return all fields excluding Comments and Description.

Thx
fields.summary: Improve fields limitation in searchrequest-xml
